member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServices.WindowsServiceHelpers
member.summary: Helper methods for Windows Services.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServices.WindowsServiceHelpers.IsWindowsService
member.summary: Check if the current process is hosted as a Windows Service.
member.returns: True if the current process is hosted as a Windows Service, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServices.WindowsServiceLifetime.StopAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Called from to stop the service if not already stopped, and wait for the service dispatcher to exit. Once this method returns the service is stopped and the process can be terminated at any time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServices.WindowsServiceLifetime.OnStop
member.summary: Executes when a Stop command is sent to the service by the Service Control Manager (SCM). Triggers and waits for . Shortly after this method returns, the Service will be marked as stopped in SCM and the process may exit at any point.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServices.WindowsServiceLifetime.OnShutdown
member.summary: Executes when a Shutdown command is sent to the service by the Service Control Manager (SCM). Triggers and waits for . Shortly after this method returns, the Service will be marked as stopped in SCM and the process may exit at any point.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServiceLifetimeHostBuilderExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for setting up WindowsServiceLifetime.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServiceLifetimeHostBuilderExtensions.UseWindowsService(Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder)
member.summary: Sets the host lifetime to and enables logging to the event log with the application name as the default source name.
member.remarks: This is context aware and will only activate if it detects the process is running as a Windows Service.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServiceLifetimeHostBuilderExtensions.UseWindowsService(Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder,System.Action{Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServiceLifetimeOptions})
member.summary: Sets the host lifetime to and enables logging to the event log with the application name as the default source name.
member.remarks: This is context aware and will only activate if it detects the process is running as a Windows Service.

member.summary: Configures the lifetime of the built from to and enables logging to the event log with the application name as the default source name.
member.remarks: This is context aware and will only activate if it detects the process is running as a Windows Service.
member.param: The used to build the . For example, or the passed to the callback.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServiceLifetimeHostBuilderExtensions.AddWindowsService(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServiceLifetimeOptions})
member.summary: Configures the lifetime of the built from to and enables logging to the event log with the application name as the default source name.
member.remarks: This is context aware and will only activate if it detects the process is running as a Windows Service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.WindowsServiceLifetimeOptions.ServiceName
member.summary: The name used to identify the service to the system.

member.summary: Throws an if is null.

The name of the parameter with which corresponds.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to indicate a source generator should create a function for marshalling arguments instead of relying on the runtime to generate an equivalent marshalling function at run-time.
member.remarks: This attribute is meaningless if the source generator associated with it is not enabled. The current built-in source generator only supports C# and only supplies an implementation when applied to static, partial, non-generic methods.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .
member.param: Name of the library containing the import.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.LibraryName
member.summary: Gets the name of the library containing the import.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.EntryPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the entry point to be called.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.StringMarshalling
member.summary: Gets or sets how to marshal string arguments to the method.
member.remarks: If this field is set to a value other than , must not be specified.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.StringMarshallingCustomType
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to control how string arguments to the method are marshalled.
member.remarks: If this field is specified, must not be specified or must be set to .

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.SetLastError
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the callee sets an error (SetLastError on Windows or errno on other platforms) before returning from the attributed method.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling
member.summary: Specifies how strings should be marshalled for generated p/invokes

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling.Custom
member.summary: Indicates the user is suppling a specific marshaller in .

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling.Utf8
member.summary: Use the platform-provided UTF-8 marshaller.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling.Utf16
member.summary: Use the platform-provided UTF-16 marshaller.
